declares.name: require
declares.description:
Load type information for an external module. Analogous to Node's require function.

This method assumes that the .d.json file is in the same directory as the .js file that it contains type
information for. Just like Node's require function, if a relative path is specified, it is considered to be
relative to the source file that called require. Also like Node's require function, files are loaded
synchronously. If you would like to load type information asynchronously, see the load function.

parameters.name: moduleName
parameters.description: The name of the module to load.

declares.name: reference
declares.description:
Load type information for an internal module or global declarations. Analogous to TypeScript's reference tags.

This method assumes that the .d.json file is in the same directory as the .js file that it contains type
information for. Just like TypeScript's /// <reference path="... tags, the path is considered to be relative to
the source file that called reference. Files are loaded synchronously. If you would like to load type information
asynchronously, see the load function.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the file to load.

declares.name: load
declares.description:
Asynchronously load type information for the given filename pattern(s).

This method assumes that the .d.json files are in the same directory as the .js file that they contain type
information for. The load method supports [glob](https://github.com/isaacs/node-glob) patterns for filename
matching. Relative paths are considered to be relative to the current working directory.

Once all declaration files have been loaded, the callback is called with the symbols for any external
modules. If no external modules were loaded an empty array is passed to the callback. The list of symbols
does not include any global symbols that were loaded.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description:
A string containing the path to load or an array containing the paths to load. Glob patterns are
supported.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the load operation completes.

declares.name: resolve
declares.description:
Finds the symbol for the given entity name in the global scope. If a global symbol with the given name cannot
be found, undefined is returned.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: The global entity name to resolve.

signatures.name: getName
signatures.description: Gets the name of the symbol.

signatures.name: getFullName
signatures.description: Gets the qualified name of the symbol.

signatures.name: getDescription
signatures.description: Gets the description of the symbol.

signatures.name: getAnnotations
signatures.description:
Finds annotations with the specified name. If no name is specified, then all annotations
are returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the annotation to find.

signatures.name: hasAnnotation
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbols has an annotation with the specified name; Otherwise, returns false.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the annotation to find.

signatures.name: getType
signatures.description: Gets the type of the symbol.

signatures.name: getDeclaredType
signatures.description:
Gets the type declared by the symbol. For a class getType() returns the static side of the class
and getDeclaredType() returns the instance side of the class.

signatures.name: getExports
signatures.description:
Gets all symbols exported by this symbol. This is used to get the members of a module or the static
members of a class.

signatures.name: resolve
signatures.description:
Finds the symbol for the given entity name relative to the current symbol. If a symbol with the given name
cannot be found, undefined is returned.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: The entity name to resolve.

signatures.name: getValue
signatures.description: Gets the value of the property, variable, or accessor represented by the symbol on the given object.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to get the value for.

signatures.name: setValue
signatures.description: Sets the value of the property, variable, or accessor represented by the symbol on the given object.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to set the value on.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set.

signatures.name: isVariable
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a variable; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isFunction
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a function; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isClass
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a class; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isInterface
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is an interface; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isEnum
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is an enum; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isModule
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a module; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isImport
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is an import; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isTypeParameter
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a type parameter; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isProperty
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a class or interface property; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isMethod
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a class or interface method; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isAccessor
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is an accessor; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isGetAccessor
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a get accessor; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isSetAccessor
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a set accessor; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isEnumMember
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is an enum member; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isTypeAlias
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbol is a type alias; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: name
signatures.description: The name of the annotation.

signatures.name: value
signatures.description: The value of the annotation.

signatures.name: getDeclarationFileName
signatures.description: Returns the name of the file that the annotation was declared in.

signatures.name: getName
signatures.description: Gets the name of the type, if any.

signatures.name: getFullName
signatures.description: Gets the qualified name of the type, if any.

signatures.name: getDescription
signatures.description: Gets the description of the type.

signatures.name: getAnnotations
signatures.description: Gets all annotations declared for the type.

parameters.name: inherit
parameters.description: True if annotations should be inherited from base types.

signatures.name: getAnnotations
signatures.description:
Finds annotations with the specified name. If no name is specified, then all annotations
are returns.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the annotation to find.

parameters.name: inherit
parameters.description: True if annotations should be inherited from base types.

signatures.name: hasAnnotation
signatures.description: Returns true if the type has an annotation with the specified name; Otherwise, returns false.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the annotation to find.

parameters.name: inherit
parameters.description: True if base types should be checked for the annotation as well.

signatures.name: getProperties
signatures.description:
Gets a list of all properties of the type. Note that properties include fields, accessors, and
methods.

signatures.name: getProperty
signatures.description:
Finds a property with the specified name. If no property is found, undefined is returned. Note that
properties include fields, accessors, and methods.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The property name to find.

signatures.name: getCallSignatures
signatures.description: Gets all call signatures of the type.

signatures.name: getConstructSignatures
signatures.description: Gets all construct signatures of the type.

signatures.name: getStringIndexType
signatures.description:
Gets the string index type of the type. For example, for { [key: string]: boolean }, getStringIndexType()
will return the intrinsic boolean type.

signatures.name: getNumberIndexType
signatures.description:
Gets the number index type of the type. For example, for { [key: number]: string }, getNumberIndexType()
will return the intrinsic string type.

signatures.name: isIdenticalTo
signatures.description:
Returns true if the target type is identical to the current type; Otherwise, returns false. If diagnostic
information regarding the differences between the types is desired, any empty array should be passed to
the diagnostics parameter.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target type.

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: Array where diagnostic information regarding the differences between the types is placed.

signatures.name: isSubtypeOf
signatures.description:
Returns true if the target type is a subtype of the current type; Otherwise, returns false. If diagnostic
information regarding the differences between the types is desired, any empty array should be passed to
the diagnostics parameter.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target type.

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: Array where diagnostic information regarding the differences between the types is placed.

signatures.name: isAssignableTo
signatures.description:
Returns true if the target type is assignable to the current type; Otherwise, returns false. If diagnostic
information regarding the differences between the types is desired, any empty array should be passed to
the diagnostics parameter.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target type.

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: Array where diagnostic information regarding the differences between the types is placed.

signatures.name: isSubclassOf
signatures.description: Returns true if the target type if a subclass of the current type; Otherwise, returns false.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target type.

signatures.name: getBaseClass
signatures.description: Gets the base class of a class type.

signatures.name: getBaseTypes
signatures.description: Gets the base types of a class or interface type.

signatures.name: hasBaseType
signatures.description: Returns true if the target type is a base type of the current type; Otherwise, returns false.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target type.

signatures.name: isClass
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is a class; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isInterface
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is an interface; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isTuple
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is a tuple; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isUnion
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is a union type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isArray
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is an array; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isIndex
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is an index type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isAnonymous
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is anonymous; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isReference
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is a generic reference; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isEnum
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is an enum; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isStringLiteral
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is a string literal; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isTypeParameter
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is a type parameter; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isAny
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is the intrinsic any type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isString
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is the intrinsic string type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isNumber
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is the intrinsic number type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isBoolean
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is the intrinsic boolean type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isVoid
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is the intrinsic void type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isIntrinsic
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is an intrinsic type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: isObjectType
signatures.description: Returns true if the type is an object type; Otherwise, returns false.

signatures.name: getEnumValue
signatures.description: Gets the numeric enum value for the given member name.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The enum member name to get the value for.

parameters.name: ignoreCase
parameters.description: True if case should be ignored when finding the member name.

signatures.name: getEnumName
signatures.description: Gets the enum member name for the given numeric enum value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The numeric value to get the name for.

signatures.name: getEnumNames
signatures.description: Gets a list of enum member names.

signatures.name: getElementType
signatures.description: Gets the element type for an array type.

signatures.name: getElementTypes
signatures.description: Gets the element types a tuple type.

signatures.name: createInstance
signatures.description:
Creates an instance of a class. If arguments are provided then the constructor is called; Otherwise,
the object is created without calling the constructor. To call a parameter-less constructor, pass an empty
array to args.

Note that This method assumes that the .d.json file is in the same directory as the .js file that it contains
type information for. For external modules, Node's require method is used to load the JavaScript module.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: The constructor arguments.

signatures.name: getConstructor
signatures.description:
Gets the JavaScript constructor for a class type.

Note that This method assumes that the .d.json file is in the same directory as the .js file that it contains
type information for. For external modules, Node's require method is used to load the JavaScript module.

signatures.name: getDescription
signatures.description: Gets a description of the signature.

signatures.name: getAnnotations
signatures.description:
Finds annotations with the specified name. If no name is specified, then all annotations
are returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the annotation to find.

signatures.name: hasAnnotation
signatures.description: Returns true if the symbols has an annotation with the specified name; Otherwise, returns false.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the annotation to find.

signatures.name: getParameters
signatures.description: Gets a list of all parameters for the call signature.

signatures.name: getParameter
signatures.description:
Gets a parameter for the signature with the specified name. If no parameter matches the name then undefined
is returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The parameter name to find.

signatures.name: getReturnType
signatures.description: Gets the return type of the signature.

signatures.name: filename
signatures.description: The name of the .d.json file that contained the error

signatures.name: messageText
signatures.description: Message explaining the error.

signatures.name: code
signatures.description: Error code.

declares.name: DiagnosticError
declares.description: Extension of standard Error that includes diagnostic information.

signatures.name: diagnostics
signatures.description: Array of Diagnostics that provides details on the error that occurred.
